children.name: cartName
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Name of a defined cart for the user who is currently logged
                in.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cart = new sn_sc.CartJS(cart1);

children.name: CartJS(String cartName)
children.text:
Creates an instance of the CartJS class with the name of a defined cart for the user
    who is currently logged in.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) { var cart = new sn_sc.CartJS(); var item = { 'sysparm_id': '0d08837237153000158bbfc8bcbe5d02', 'sysparm_quantity': '1', 'variables':{ 'carrier': 'at_and_t_mobility', 'data_plan': '500MB', 'duration': 'eighteen_months', 'color': 'slate', 'storage': 'sixtyfour' }}; var cartDetails = cart.addToCart(item); gs.info(JSON.stringify(cartDetails)); }
children.text2: This shows how you can add multiple items to the cart. Note that var cart = new sn_sc.CartJS(); is inside the loop. You must call sn_sc.CartJS() multiple times to be able to add multiple items to the cart.

children.name: JSON
request
children.text: Map
children.text2:
A JSON object that contains the details of the catalog item to be added to the cart.

The structure of the request object is:

{
'sysparm_id': item_id,
'sysparm_quantity': item_quantity,
'variables':{
'var_name': 'var_value',
...
}
}
  • item_id: sys_id of the item to be added to the cart
  • item_quantity: Number of items to be added. Default value is 1.
  • var_name: Name of the question.
  • var_value: Value of the answer (Not the display value).

children.name: addToCart(Map request)
children.text: Adds the request for a catalog item to the current cart.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the user has the required role to edit the requested for field.

Valid values:

  • true: user has the required role
  • false: user does not have the required role

children.name: Output
children.text: true

children.name: Example
children.text: var cart=new sn_sc.CartJS(); console.log(cart.canViewRF());
children.text2: This  checks if the user has the role needed to edit the requested for field.

children.name: canViewRF()
children.text: Specifies if the current user has the required role to edit the Request for field.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var cart = new sn_sc.CartJS(); var checkoutInfo = cart.checkoutCart(); gs.info(checkoutInfo);

children.name: JSON
children.text:
If the two-step checkout is enabled, the summary of the items in the cart is returned.
{ "subtotal_price":"",
  "subtotal_recurring_frequency":"",
  "delivery_address":"",
  "special_instructions":"",
  "total_title":"",
  "requested_for_user":"System Administrator",
  "requested_for":"6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441",
  “daily”: ["frequency_subtotal":"", "items":[{}, {}, ...], …],
  “monthly”:["frequency_subtotal":"", "items":[{}, {}, ...], …],
  “annually”:["frequency_subtotal":"", "items":[{}, {}, ...], …],
  "none":["frequency_subtotal":"", "items":[{}, {}, ...], …],
}
If the two-step checkout is disabled:
{
  'request_id' : "sys_id of the generated request",
  "request_number" : "Number of the generated request"
}

children.name: checkoutCart()
children.text:
Performs the cart checkout. If the two-step checkout is enabled, returns the order
    summary. If the two-step checkout is disabled, the cart is submitted and details of the
    generated request are returned.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: Example
children.text: var cart = new sn_sc.CartJS(); cart.empty();

children.name: empty()
children.text: Deletes the current cart.

children.name: Object
children.text: Object pointing to the current cart details.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var cart=new sn_sc.CartJS(); console.log (cart.getCartDetails());

children.name: getCartDetails()
children.text: Returns the cart details.

children.name: String
children.text: sys_id for the current cart.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cart = new sn_sc.CartJS(); cart.getCartID(); gs.info(cartId);

children.name: getCartID()
children.text: Returns the cart id of the current cart.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var cart = new sn_sc.CartJS(); var cartItems = cart.getCartItems(); while (cartItems.next()) { gs.info(cartItems.getElement('quantity').getDisplayValue() + " x " + cartItems.getElement('cat_item').getDisplayValue()); }
children.text2: Returns quantity and Catalog Item field values for items in the current cart.

children.name: GlideRecord
children.text:
GlideRecord object including records and fields from the Item [sc_cart_item]
                table that describe an item in the current cart.

children.name: getCartItems()
children.text:
Returns a GlideRecord object containing records for items in the current
    cart.

children.name: Output
children.text: Brasilia, Brasil

children.name: Example
children.text: var cart = new sn_sc.CartJS(); cart.setDeliveryAddress("Brasilia, Brasil"); cart.getDeliveryAddress(); gs.info(DeliveryAddress);

children.name: String
children.text: Delivery address for the current cart.

children.name: getDeliveryAddress()
children.text: Gets the delivery address for the current cart.

children.name: String
children.text:
sys_id from the sys_user record of the user for whom the cart is
                requested.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cart = new sn_sc.CartJS(); cart.setRequestedFor("039c516237b1300054b6a3549dbe5dfc") cart.getRequestedFor(); gs.info(cartId);

children.name: getRequestedFor()
children.text:
Gets the sys_id from the sys_user record of the user for whom the cart is
    requested.

children.name: Output
children.text: Abel Tuter

children.name: Example
children.text: var cart = new sn_sc.CartJS(); cart.getRequestedForDisplayName(); gs.info(DisplayName);

children.name: String
children.text:
Name from the user record of the user for whom the current cart is
                requested.

children.name: getRequestedForDisplayName()
children.text:
Gets the name from the user record of the user for whom the current cart is
    requested.

children.name: String
children.text: Special instructions for the current cart.

children.name: Output
children.text: Delivery before 8 AM.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cart = new sn_sc.CartJS(); cart.setSpecialInstructions("Delivery before 8 AM."); cart.getSpecialInstructions(); gs.info(SpecialInstructions);

children.name: getSpecialInstructions()
children.text: Gets the special instructions for the current cart.

children.name: JSON key/value pairs
Output
Example
children.text: var cart = new sn_sc.CartJS(); var request = { 'sysparm_id': '0d08837237153000158bbfc8bcbe5d02', 'sysparm_quantity': '1', 'variables':{ 'carrier': 'at_and_t_mobility', 'data_plan': '500MB', 'duration': 'eighteen_months', 'color': 'slate', 'storage': 'sixtyfour' } } var cartDetails = cart.orderNow(request); gs.info(cartDetails);

children.name: request
children.text: Map
children.text2: JSON object that contains details of the catalog item to order.

children.name: request.delivery_address
children.text: String
children.text2:
Address to which to deliver the items.

Default: Address of user

children.name: request.sysparm_id
children.text: String
children.text2: Required. The sys_id of the item to purchase.

children.name: request.special_instructions
children.text: String
children.text2: Instructions to follow when processing the order.

children.name: request.sysparm_quantity
children.text: String
children.text2:
Quantity of the specified item to purchase.

Default: 1

children.name: request.sysparm_requested_for
children.text: String
children.text2:
The sys_id of the user for whom the item is requested.

Default: Session user

children.name: request.variables
children.text: Array
children.text2: Questions and customer answers associated with the item.

children.name: request.variables.var_name
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the question.

children.name: request.variables.var_value
children.text: String
children.text2: Customer's response to the associated question.

children.name: orderNow(Map request)
children.text:
Orders a single item. If two-step checkout is enabled, the method adds the specified
    item to the cart and returns the sys_id of the cart. If two-step checkout is disabled, the
    method completes the purchase of the specified item and returns the sys_id of the generated
    request.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: address
children.text: String
children.text2: Delivery address for the current cart.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cart = new sn_sc.CartJS(); cart.setDeliveryAddress("Brasilia, Brasil");

children.name: setDeliveryAddress(String address)
children.text: Sets the delivery address for the current cart.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: user
children.text: String
children.text2:
sys_id to be set in the sys_user record of the user for whom the cart is
                requested.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cart = new sn_sc.CartJS(); cart.setRequestedFor("039c516237b1300054b6a3549dbe5dfc")

children.name: setRequestedFor(String user)
children.text:
Sets the sys_id in the sys_user record of the user for whom the cart is
    requested.

children.name: specialInstructions
children.text: String
children.text2: Special instructions for the current cart.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cart = new sn_sc.CartJS(); cart.setSpecialInstructions("Delivery before 8 AM.");

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: setSpecialInstructions(String specialInstructions)
children.text: Sets the special instructions for the current cart.

children.name: JSON
request
children.text: Map
children.text2:
A JSON object that contains details of the cart to be submitted.

The structure of the request object is:

{
  'special_instructions' : 'instructions',
  'sysparm_requested_for' : requested_for,
  'delivery_address' : 'address'
}
  • instructions: Special instructions for the request.
  • requested_for : sys_id of the requested_for user.
  • address: Delivery address for the request.

children.name: Output
children.text: {"request_id":"6eed229047801200e0ef563dbb9a71c2", "request_number": "REQ0000001"}

children.name: Example
children.text: var cart = new sn_sc.CartJS(); var request = { 'special_instructions' : 'Delivery only in working hours', 'requested_for' : '62826bf03710200044e0bfc8bcbe5df1', 'delivery_address' : "Brasilia, Brasil", }; var requestDetails = cart.submitOrder(request); gs.info(requestDetails);

children.name: submitOrder(Map request)
children.text: Updates special instructions, requested for, and delivery address from the request parameter and performs the cart checkout. Use this API to modify the mentioned parameters of the cart and perform the cart checkout simultaneously. Missing parameters in the request object will have their default value.

children.name: JSON
request
children.text: Map
children.text2:
A JSON object that contains details of the catalog item to be updated.

The structure of the request object is:

{
    'sysparm_quantity' : item_quantity,
  'sysparm_requested_for' : requested_for,
  'variables' : {
    'var_name' : 'var_value',
    ...
  }
}
  • item_quantity: Number of items to be added. Default value is 1.
  • var_name: Name of the question.
  • var_value: Value of the answer (Not the display value).

children.name: Output
children.text: { "cart_id":"35ec9e8947a13200e0ef563dbb9a7109", "items":[ { "cart_item_id":"35ec9e8947a13200e0ef563dbb9a710a", "catalog_item_id":"0d08837237153000158bbfc8bcbe5d02", "item_name":"Apple iPhone 5", "localized_price":"$799.99", "localized_recurring_price":"$30.00", "price":"$799.99", "quantity":"1", "recurring_frequency":"Monthly", "recurring_price":"$29.00" } ] "subtotal":"$799.99" }

children.name: Example
children.text: var cart = new sn_sc.CartJS(); var request = { 'sysparm_quantity': '1', 'variables':{ 'carrier': 'at_and_t_mobility', 'data_plan': '500MB', 'duration': 'eighteen_months', 'color': 'slate', 'storage': 'sixtyfour' } }; var cart_item_id = "4d69b672c322320076173b0ac3d3ae79"; var cartDetails = cart.updateItem(request, cart_item_id); gs.info(cartDetails);

children.name: cart_item_id
children.text: String
children.text2: sys_id of the cart item to be modified.

children.name: updateItem(Map request, String cart_item_id)
children.text: Updates an item in the cart.

name: CartJS
text: CartJS API enables you to access the shopping cart for a user.
text2: To use this class in a scoped application, use the sn_sc namespace identifier. The Service Catalog Scoped API plugin (ID: com.glideapp.servicecatalog.scoped.api) that is enabled by default is required to access the CartJS API.

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalogClientScript = new sn_sc.CatalogClientScript();

children.name: CatalogClientScript()
children.text: Creates an instance of the CatalogClientScript class.

children.name: script
children.text: String
children.text2: Script to be added to the catalog client script.

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalogClientScript = new sn_sc.CatalogClientScript(); catalogClientScript.addScript("function onLoad(){Enter the script}");

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: addScript(String script)
children.text: Adds a script to the catalog client script.

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalogClientScript = new sn_sc.CatalogClientScript(); catalogClientScript.appliesToCatalogItem(true);

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: flag
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
If true, the catalog client script runs on the catalog item. If false, the
                catalog client script does not run on the catalog item.

children.name: appliesToCatalogItem(Boolean flag)
children.text: Specifies if the catalog client script runs on a catalog item.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: flag
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
If true, the catalog client script runs on the catalog task. If false, the
                catalog client script does not run on the catalog task.

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalogClientScript = new sn_sc.CatalogClientScript(); catalogClientScript.appliesToCatalogTask(true);

children.name: appliesToCatalogTask(Boolean flag)
children.text: Specifies if the catalog client script runs on a catalog task.

children.name: flag
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
If true, the catalog client script runs on the requested item. If false, the
                catalog client script does not run on the requested item.

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalogClientScript = new sn_sc.CatalogClientScript(); catalogClientScript.appliesToRequestedItem(true);

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: appliesToRequestedItem(Boolean flag)
children.text: Specifies if the catalog client script runs on a requested item.

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalogClientScript = new sn_sc.CatalogClientScript(); catalogClientScript.appliesToTargetRecord(true);

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: flag
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
If true, the catalog client script runs on the target record. If false, the
                catalog client script does not run on the target record.

children.name: appliesToTargetRecord(Boolean flag)
children.text: Specifies if the catalog client script runs on a requested item.

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalogClientScript = new sn_sc.CatalogClientScript(); catalogClientScript.setAttributes({"name": "My Catalog Item", "applies_to": "item", "ui_type": "desktop", "type": "onLoad"}); catalogClientScript.appliesToCatalogItem(true); catalogClientScript.appliesToRequestedItem(true); catalogClientScript.appliesToCatalogTask(true); catalogClientScript.appliesToTargetRecord(true); var catalogClientScriptId = catalogClientScript.create(); gs.info(catalogClientScriptId);

children.name: String
children.text: sys_id of the catalog client script.

children.name: standardUpdate
children.text: Boolean
children.text2: Set to true to enable the running of engines and workflow.

children.name: create(Boolean standardUpdate)
children.text: Inserts the defined catalog client script in the catalog_script_client table.

children.name: Example
children.text: var sys_id = "039c516237b1300054b6a3549dbe5dfc"; var catalogClientScript = new sn_sc.CatalogClientScript(); catalogClientScript.deleteRecord("039c516237b1300054b6a3549dbe5dfc");

children.name: sys_id
children.text: String
children.text2: sys_id of the catalog client script.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: standardUpdate
children.text: Boolean
children.text2: Set to true to enable the running of engines and workflow.

children.name: deleteRecord(String sys_id, Boolean standardUpdate)
children.text: Deletes the defined catalog client script.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: attributes
children.text: Map
children.text2: A JSON object that has mapping for the field and value pairs.

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalogClientScript = new sn_sc.CatalogClientScript(); catalogClientScript.setAttributes({"name": "My Catalog Item", "applies_to": "catalog_item", "ui_type": "desktop", "type": "onLoad"});

children.name: setAttributes(Map attributes)
children.text: Defines attribute values for the catalog client script.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: sys_id
children.text: String
children.text2: sys_id of the catalog item.

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalogClientScript = new sn_sc.CatalogClientScript(); catalogClientScript.setCatalogItem("039c516237b1300054b6a3549dbe5dfc");

children.name: setCatalogItem(String sys_id)
children.text: Associates a catalog item with the catalog client script.

children.name: sys_id
children.text: String
children.text2: sys_id of the variable.

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalogClientScript = new sn_sc.CatalogClientScript(); catalogClientScript.setOnChangeVariable("039c516237b1300054b6a3549dbe5dfc");

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: setOnChangeVariable(String sys_id)
children.text: Runs the catalog client script when a variable value is updated.

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalogClientScript = new sn_sc.CatalogClientScript(); catalogClientScript.setVariableSet("039c516237b1300054b6a3549dbe5dfc");

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: sys_id
children.text: String
children.text2: sys_id of the variable set.

children.name: setVariableSet(String sys_id)
children.text: Associates a variable set with the catalog client script.

name: CatalogClientScript
text: CatalogClientScript API enables you to create, modify, or delete catalog client script records.
text2: To use this class in a scoped application, use the sn_sc namespace identifier. The Service Catalog Scoped API plugin (ID: com.glideapp.servicecatalog.scoped.api) that is enabled by default is required to access the CatalogClientScript API.

children.name: String
children.text: Return the sys_id of the inserted variable record.

children.name: standardUpdate
children.text: Boolean
children.text2: Set to true to enable the running of engines and workflow.

children.name: create(Boolean standardUpdate)
children.text: Insert the defined catalog item variable.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: standardUpdate
children.text: Boolean
children.text2: Set to true to enable the running of engines and workflow.

children.name: deleteRecord(Boolean standardUpdate)

children.text: Object
children.text2: Specify the set of columns that you would like the values for.

children.name: Object

children.name: standardUpdate
children.text: Boolean
children.text2: Set to true to enable the running of engines and workflow.

children.name: read(Object columns, Boolean standardUpdate)
children.text: Get a mapping of catalog item variable attribute values.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: attributes
children.text: Object
children.text2: An object mapping column names to values.

children.name: setAttributes(Object attributes)
children.text: Define attribute values for this catalog item variable.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: columnValues
children.text: Object
children.text2: An object mapping column names to values.

children.name: standardUpdate
children.text: Boolean
children.text2: Set to true to enable the running of engines and workflow.

children.name: update(Object columnValues, Boolean standardUpdate)
children.text: Use to update current catalog item variable with set values.

name: CatalogItemVariable
text: CatalogItemVariable API enables you to create and modify service catalog item variables using scripts.

children.name: standardUpdate
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag indicating whether to enable the running of engines and workflow.
Valid values:
  • true: Enable the running of engines and workflow.
  • false: Do not enable the running of engines and workflow.

children.name: Example
children.text: // Given an existing catalog item var catItemSysId = "e0d08b13c3330100c8b837659bba8fb4"; addVariableSets(catItemSysId); function addVariableSets(catItemSysId) { // List of all variable sets to attach var myVarSets = []; // Create variable set var myVarSetAttrs = {"name": "Requester details", "order": "100"}; var myVarSet = new sn_sc.CatalogItemVariableSet(); myVarSet.setAttributes(myVarSetAttrs); var myVarSetId = myVarSet.create(true); myVarSets.push(myVarSetId); }

children.name: String
children.text: Sys_id of the inserted variable record.

children.text: Inserts the defined catalog item variable set.

name: CatalogItemVariableSetM2M
text: CatalogItemVariableSetM2M API enables you to create and modify service catalog item variable set many-to-many (M2Ms) using scripts.

children.name: gr
children.text: Object
children.text2: Glide Record pointing to the sc_catalog table.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gr = new GlideRecord('sc_catalog'); now_GR.addQuery('sys_id','e0d08b13c3330100c8b837659bba8fb4'); now_GR.query(); var Catalog = new sn_sc.Catalog(now_GR);

children.name: Catalog(GlideRecord gr)
children.text:
Creates an instance of the catalog class for the specified glide record
    object.

children.name: Example
children.text: new sn_sc.Catalog(catalog_sys_id); var Catalog = new sn_sc.Catalog("31bea3d53790200044e0bfc8bcbe5dec");

children.name: sys_id
children.text: String
children.text2: sys_id of the Catalog.

children.name: Catalog(String sys_id)
children.text: Creates an instance of the Catalog class with the specified sys_id.

children.name: Output
children.text: true

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalog=new sn_sc.Catalog("e0d08b13c3330100c8b837659bba8fb4");; console.log (catalog.canView(true));

children.name: Boolean
children.text: Returns true if the catalog is viewable for the user.

children.name: mobile
children.text: Boolean
children.text2: True if the view is mobile view. Else, false.

children.name: canView(boolean mobile)
children.text: Specifies if the catalog is viewable for the user.

children.name: Object
children.text: Object pointing to the earliest catalog that the user can view.

children.name: Output
children.text: catalog is the CatalogJS object

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalog = sn_sc.Catalog. getAvailableCatalog()

children.name: getAvailableCatalog()
children.text:
If only one active catalog exists, that catalog is returned. Else, the earliest catalog
    created is returned, from the list of the catalogs that the user can view. If no catalog is
    available, null is returned.

children.name: String
children.text: Background color of the catalog.

children.name: Output
children.text: #FFFFFF

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalog=new sn_sc.Catalog("e0d08b13c3330100c8b837659bba8fb4"); console.log(catalog.getBackgroundColor());

children.name: getBackgroundColor()
children.text: Returns the catalog background color.

children.name: Example
children.text: console.log (sn_sc.Catalog.getCatalogCount());

children.name: Integer
children.text: Number of catalogs available in the catalog table.

children.name: getCatalogCount()
children.text: Specifies the number of catalogs active in the catalog table.

children.name: ArrayList
children.text: Returns the categories for the specified catalog.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var catalog=new sn_sc.Catalog("e0d08b13c3330100c8b837659bba8fb4"); console.log(catalog.getCategories());

children.name: getCategories()
children.text: Returns the categories for the specified catalog.

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalog=new sn_sc.Catalog("e0d08b13c3330100c8b837659bba8fb4"); console.log(catalog.getCategoryIds());

children.name: ArrayList
children.text: Returns the sys_ids of the categories in the specified catalog.

children.name: getCategoryIds()
children.text: Specifies the sys_ids of the categories in the specified catalog.

children.name: String
children.text: Catalog description.

children.name: Output
children.text: Service Catalog - IT Now

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalog=new sn_sc.Catalog("e0d08b13c3330100c8b837659bba8fb4"); console.log(catalog.getDescription());

children.name: getDescription()
children.text: Specifies the catalog description.

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalog=new sn_sc.Catalog("e0d08b13c3330100c8b837659bba8fb4"); console.log(catalog.getDesktopImageSRC());

children.name: String
children.text: Catalog desktop image value.

children.name: getDesktopImageSRC()
children.text: Returns the catalog desktop image value.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var catalog=new sn_sc.Catalog("e0d08b13c3330100c8b837659bba8fb4"); data.history=catalog.getGr();

children.name: GlideRecord
children.text: GlideRecord of the catalog.

children.name: getGr()
children.text: Returns the catalog gliderecord.

children.name: Output
children.text: null

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalog=new sn_sc.Catalog("e0d08b13c3330100c8b837659bba8fb4"); console.log(catalog.getHeaderIconSRC());

children.name: String
children.text: Catalog header icon.

children.name: getHeaderIconSRC()
children.text: Returns the catalog header icon.

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalog=new sn_sc.Catalog("e0d08b13c3330100c8b837659bba8fb4"); console.log(catalog.getId());

children.name: String
children.text: sys_id of the catalog.

children.name: getID()
children.text: Specifies the sys_id of the catalog.

children.name: Output
children.text: Service Catalog

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalog=new sn_sc.Catalog("e0d08b13c3330100c8b837659bba8fb4"); console.log(catalog.getTitle());

children.name: String
children.text: Title of the catalog

children.name: getTitle()
children.text: Returns the title of the catalog.

children.name: Boolean
children.text: Returns true if the catalog has categories. Else returns false.

children.name: Output
children.text: false

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalog=new sn_sc.Catalog("e0d08b13c3330100c8b837659bba8fb4"); console.log(catalog.hasCategories());

children.name: hasCategories()
children.text: Specifies if the catalog has categories.

children.name: Output
children.text: true

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalog=new sn_sc.Catalog("e0d08b13c3330100c8b837659bba8fb4"); console.log(catalog.hasItems());

children.name: Boolean
children.text: Returns true if the catalog has catalog items. Else returns false.

children.name: hasItems()
children.text: Specifies if the catalog has catalog items.

children.name: Boolean
children.text: Returns true if wish list is enabled for a catalog. Else returns false.

children.name: Output
children.text: true

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalog=new sn_sc.Catalog("e0d08b13c3330100c8b837659bba8fb4"); console.log(catalog.isWishlistEnabled());

children.name: isWishlistEnabled()
children.text: Specifies if the wish list is enabled for a catalog.

name: CatalogJS
text: The CatalogJS API enables you to use methods to check and retrieve catalog-specific properties.
text2: To use this class in a scoped application, use the sn_sc namespace identifier. The Service Catalog Scoped API plugin (com.glideapp.servicecatalog.scoped.api) that is enabled by default is required to access the CatalogJS API.

children.name: Example
children.text: var catSearchGR = new sn_sc.CatalogSearch().search('', '', 'Apple', false, true); catSearchGR.query(); while(catSearchGR.next()) { gs.info(catSearchGR.getValue('name')); }

children.name: CatalogSearch()
children.text: Creates an instance of the CatalogSearch class.

children.name: catalogID
children.text: String
children.text2: Identifier of the catalog to search.

children.name: GlideRecord
children.text: Returns the GlideRecord on sc_cat_item matching the search result.

children.name: Output
children.text: ServiceNow T-shirt

children.name: Example
children.text: var now_GR = new sn_sc.CatalogSearch().search('', '', 'ServiceNow', false, false); now_GR.query(); while(now_GR.next()) { gs.log(now_GR.name); }
children.text2: This  shows how to search all catalogs and all categories for term: ServiceNow.

children.name: categoryID
children.text: String
children.text2: Identifier of the catalog category to search.

children.name: mobile
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether catalog items exposed for mobile are searched.
Valid values:
  • true: Search for mobile catalog items.
  • false: Do not search for mobile catalog items.

children.name: term
children.text: String
children.text2: Search term.

children.name: depthSearch
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to search subcategories.
Valid values:
  • true: Do not search subcategories.
  • false: Search subcategories.

children.name: search (String catalogID, String categoryID, String term, Boolean mobile, Boolean depthSearch)
children.text:
Searches a catalog item based on a search term. The search can be narrowed down to a
    catalog category level.

name: CatalogSearch
text: CatalogSearch API enables you to search catalog item.
text2: To use this class in a scoped application, use the sn_sc namespace identifier. The Service Catalog Scoped API plugin (ID: com.glideapp.servicecatalog.scoped.api) that is enabled by default is required to access the CatalogSearch API.

children.name: action
children.text: String
children.text2:
Specify add to add the user criteria to the Available For list.

Specify delete to delete the user criteria from the Available For list.

children.name: Example
children.text: var item = new sn_sc.CatCategory("31bea3d53790200044e0bfc8bcbe5dec"); item. availableForUserCriteria("add", ["0c441abbc6112275000025157c651c89"]);

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: criteriaIDs
children.text: Array
children.text2: Array of the user criteria sys_ids.

children.name: availableForUserCriteria(String action, Array[] criteriaIDs)
children.text: Adds the Available For user criteria to a catalog category.

children.name: isMobile
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to verify the user for access on a mobile device or desktop.
  • true: validate for mobile.
  • false: validate for desktop.

children.name: Example
children.text: var scopedCategoryObj = new sn_sc.CatCategory('7b1262b9530033007444ddeeff7b12ae'); scopedCategoryObj.canView(false, '62826bf03710200044e0bfc8bcbe5df1');

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the user can view the associated category.
  • true: user can view the category.
  • false: user cannot view the category.

children.name: userSysId
children.text: String
children.text2: Unique identifier of the user to validate.

children.name: canView(Boolean isMobile, String userSysId)
children.text:
Determines whether a specified user can view a specified category on a mobile device or
    desktop.

children.name: Example
children.text: var categoryCreate = new sn_sc.CatCategory(); categoryCreate.setAttributes({"title" : "test a scoped category", "sc_catalog" : "e0d08b13c3330100c8b837659bba8fb4"}); var categorySysId = categoryCreate.create(); var isValidSysId = categorySysId.match(/^[0-9a-fA-F]{32}$/) == null ? false : true; global.Assert.assertEquals(true, isValidSysId,"CategorySysId: ["+ categorySysId +"] is not valid", true, isValidSysId);

children.name: String
children.text: Return the sys_id of the inserted variable record.

children.name: standardUpdate
children.text: Boolean
children.text2: Set to true to enable the running of engines and workflow.

children.name: create(Boolean standardUpdate)
children.text: Insert the defined category.

children.name: Example
children.text: var categoryDelete = new sn_sc.CatCategory(categorySysId); categoryDelete.deleteRecord(); var category = new sn_sc.CatCategory(categorySysId); values = category.read({"title" : "", "sc_catalog":""}, false); global.Assert.assertEquals("", values.title,"Category should title");

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: standardUpdate
children.text: Boolean
children.text2: Set to true to enable the running of engines and workflow.

children.name: deleteRecord(Boolean standardUpdate)
children.text:
Deletes the category record on which the CatCategory class was initially
    instantiated.

children.name: String
children.text: sys_id of the category.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cart = new sn_sc.CatCategory("2809952237b1300054b6a3549dbe5dd4"); var categoryID = cart.getID(); gs.info(categoryID);

children.name: getID()
children.text: Returns the sys_id of the category.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: action
children.text: String
children.text2:
Specify add to add the user criteria to the Not Available For list.

Specify delete to delete the user criteria from the Not Available For list.

children.name: Example
children.text: var item = new sn_sc.CatCategory("31bea3d53790200044e0bfc8bcbe5dec"); item. notAvailableForUserCriteria("add", ["0c441abbc6112275000025157c651c89"]);

children.name: notAvailableForUserCriteria(String action, Array[] criteriaIDs)
children.text: Adds the Not Available For user criteria to a catalog category.

children.name: columns
children.text: Object
children.text2: Specify the set of columns that you would like the values for.

children.name: Example
children.text: var category = new sn_sc.CatCategory("a96277509f300200b407b89a442e704e"); var values = category.read({"title" : ""}, true); gs.log(values.title);

children.name: Object
children.text: An object mapping column names to values.

children.name: standardUpdate
children.text: Boolean
children.text2: Set to true to enable the running of engines and workflow.

children.name: read(Object columns, Boolean standardUpdate)
children.text: Get a mapping of the category.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: Example
children.text: var categoryCreate = new sn_sc.CatCategory(); categoryCreate.setAttributes({"title" : "test a scoped category", "sc_catalog" : "e0d08b13c3330100c8b837659bba8fb4"}); var categorySysId = categoryCreate.create(); var isValidSysId = categorySysId.match(/^[0-9a-fA-F]{32}$/) == null ? false : true; global.Assert.assertEquals(true, isValidSysId,"CategorySysId: ["+ categorySysId +"] is not valid", true, isValidSysId);

children.name: attributes
children.text: Object
children.text2: Set the attributes for new field and value pairs.

children.name: setAttributes(Object attributes)
children.text: Define attribute values for this category.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: tableName
children.text: String
children.text2: Specify the name of the table that extends sc_category.

children.name: Example
children.text: var categoryRead = new sn_sc.CatCategory(categorySysId); categoryRead.setTableName("test_category"); var values = categoryRead.read({"title" : "", "sc_catalog":"", "test": ""}, false); gs.info(categorySysId); gs.info(values.title); gs.info(values.test); global.Assert.assertEquals("testValue", values.test,"Category extends sc_category and stores its extended value");

children.name: setTableName(String tableName)
children.text: Define the table name for this category.

children.name: columnValues
children.text: Object
children.text2: Object mapping column names to values.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: Example
children.text: var categoryUpdate = new sn_sc.CatCategory(categorySysId); categoryUpdate.update({"title" : "test changed scoped category"}, true); values = categoryUpdate.read({"title" : "", "sc_catalog":""}, false); global.Assert.assertEquals("test changed scoped category", values.title,"Category should title");

children.name: standardUpdate
children.text: Boolean
children.text2: Set to true to enable the running of engines and workflow.

children.name: update(Object columnValues, Boolean standardUpdate)
children.text: Use to update current category.

name: CatCategory
text: CatCategory API enables you to create and modify service catalog categories using scripts.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: Example
children.text: var item = new sn_sc.CatItem("31bea3d53790200044e0bfc8bcbe5dec"); item. availableForUserCriteria("add", ["0c441abbc6112275000025157c651c89"]);

children.name: action
children.text: string
children.text2:
Specify add to add the user criteria to the Available For list.

Specify delete to delete the user criteria from the Available For list.

children.name: criteriaIDs
children.text: Array
children.text2: Array of the user criteria sys_ids.

children.name: availableForUserCriteria(String action, Array criteriaIDs)
children.text: Adds the Available For user criteria to a catalog item.

children.name: Example
children.text: var catItem = new sn_sc.CatItem("060f3afa3731300054b6a3549dbe5d3e"); gs.info(catItem.canViewInDomain());
children.text2:
This  shows how to verify whether a catalog item is viewable in the currently
        selected domain.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that validates whether the current catalog item is viewable in the selected domain.

Valid values:

  • true: Catalog item is viewable in the domain
  • false: Catalog item is not viewable in the domain

children.name: canViewInDomain()
children.text:
Verifies whether the current catalog item is viewable in the selected domain (domain
    selected in the domain picker).
children.text2: Catalog items in the global domain are available across all domains.

children.name: Output
children.text: false

children.name: Example
children.text: var cart=new sn_sc.CatItem("04b7e94b4f7b4200086eeed18110c7fd"); data.history=cart.canViewOnSearch('false');

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Returns true if the user has access to view the catalog item on global search.
                Else, returns false.

children.name: isMobile
children.text: Boolean
children.text2: True if the search is in mobile view. Else, false.

children.name: canViewOnSearch(boolean isMobile)
children.text: Specifies if the user has access to view the catalog item on global search.

children.name: standardUpdate
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to enable the running of engines and workflow.
Valid values:
  • true: Enable the running of engines and workflow.
  • false: Do not enable the running of engines and workflow. Note that the created and updated system date columns on the table are not updated.

children.name: Example
children.text: var catalogItem = new sn_sc.CatItem(); catalogItem.setAttributes({"name":"My FirstCatItem"}); catalogItem.setCatalogs(catalogSysId); // Service catalog catalogItem.setCategories(categorySysId); // Use scoped category var catItemSysId = catalogItem.create(true); // Returns sys_id of created item

children.name: String
children.text: Sys_id of the newly created catalog item.

children.name: create(Boolean standardUpdate)
children.text: Inserts the defined catalog item.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: standardUpdate
children.text: Boolean
children.text2: Set to true to enable the running of engines and workflow.

children.name: deleteRecord(Boolean standardUpdate)
children.text: Delete the defined catalog item.

children.name: Example
children.text: var CatItem=new sn_sc.CatItem("04b7e94b4f7b4200086eeed18110c7fd"); console.log(CatItem.getFirstAccessibleCategoryForSearch("e0d08b13c3330100c8b837659bba8fb4”));

children.name: String
children.text: sys_id of the first category that the user can view in a catalog.

children.name: catalogId
children.text: String
children.text2: sys_id of the catalog.

children.name: getFirstAccessibleCategoryForSearch(String catalogId)
children.text: Specifies the first category that the user can view in a catalog.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: function getInvalidDelegatedUsers(itemId, userIds) { var catItem = new sn_sc.CatItem(itemId); var invalidUsers = catItem.getInvalidDelegatedUsers(userIds); return invalidUsers; }

children.name: Array
children.text:
List of user names (Name column from Users [sys_user] table) for whom the item
                cannot be requested for by a delegate.

children.name: requestForUsers
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Array of user sys_ids to check whether the associated user can acquire the
                current item and that the item can be requested on behalf of them. User sys_ids are
                located in the Users [sys_user] table.

children.name: getInvalidDelegatedUsers(Array requestForUsers)
children.text:
Returns an array of users for whom the associated item cannot be delegated (requested
    on behalf of).
children.text2: The method verifies each of the users passed in the array.

children.name: String
children.text: Class name for the current catalog item record.

children.name: Output
children.text: sc_cat_item

children.name: Example
children.text: var CatItem=new sn_sc.CatItem("04b7e94b4f7b4200086eeed18110c7fd"); console.log(CatItem.getRecordClass());

children.name: getRecordClass()
children.text: Returns the class name for the current catalog item record.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the user has acquisition rights to the current service catalog item.
Valid values:
  • true: User has acquisition rights to the item.
  • false: User does not have acquisition rights to the item.

children.name: Output
children.text2: true

children.name: Example
children.text: function canRequestFor(itemId, user) { var catItem = new sn_sc.CatItem(itemId); var result = catItem.isDelegationAllowed(user); return result; }

children.name: delegatedUser
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Sys_id of the user to request the service catalog item for (delegate). The method verifies whether the user has acquisition rights to the item.

Default: Checks whether the calling user has acquisition rights to the item.

children.name: isDelegationAllowed(String delegatedUser)
children.text:
Verifies whether the specified delegated user has acquisition rights to the current
    service catalog item.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Returns true if the catalog item is available in service portal.  Else, returns
                false.

children.name: Output
children.text: true

children.name: Example
children.text: var CatItem=new sn_sc.CatItem("04b7e94b4f7b4200086eeed18110c7fd"); data.history=CatItem.isVisibleServicePortal();

children.name: isVisibleServicePortal()
children.text: Specifies if the catalog item is available in service portal.

children.name: action
children.text: String
children.text2:
Specify add to add the user criteria to the Not Available For list.

Specify delete to delete the user criteria from the Not Available For list.

children.name: Example
children.text: var item = new sn_sc.CatItem("31bea3d53790200044e0bfc8bcbe5dec"); item. notAvailableForUserCriteria("add", ["0c441abbc6112275000025157c651c89"]);

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: notAvailableForUserCriteria(String action, Array criteriaIDs)
children.text: Adds the Not Available For user criteria to a catalog item.

children.name: Object
children.text: An object mapping column names to values.

children.name: standardUpdate
children.text: Boolean
children.text2: Set to true to enable the running of engines and workflow.

children.name: columns
children.text: Object
children.text2: Specify the set of columns that you would like the values for.

children.name: read(Object columns, Boolean standardUpdate)
children.text: Get a mapping of catalog item attribute values.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: attributes
children.text: Object
children.text2: An object mapping column names to values.

children.name: setAttributes(Object attributes)
children.text: Define attribute values for this catalog item.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: catalogs
children.text: String
children.text2:
Specify comma-separated list of catalogs that you would like the item to be
                associated with.

children.name: setCatalogs(String catalogs)
children.text: Define the catalogs that this catalog item is associated with.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: categories
children.text: String
children.text2:
Specify comma-separated list of categories that you would like the item to be
                associated with.

children.name: setCategories(String categories)
children.text: Define the categories that this catalog item is associated with.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: dbImageSysId
children.text: String
children.text2: sys_id of an attachment referencing the db_image.

children.name: type
children.text: String
children.text2: Type can be picture or an icon.

children.name: setImage(String dbImageSysId, String type)
children.text: Set the image of a catalog item to a database image record.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: tableName
children.text: String
children.text2: Specify the name of the table that extends sc_cat_item.

children.name: setTableName(String tableName)
children.text: Define the table name for this catalog item.

children.name: columnValues
children.text: Object
children.text2: An object mapping column names to values.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.text2: Set to true to enable the running of engines and workflow.

name: CatItem
text: CatItem API enables you to create and modify service catalog items using scripts.

children.name: sys_id
children.text: String
children.text2: sys_id of the OrderGuide.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cart=new sn_sc.OrderGuide("6690750f4f7b4200086eeed18110c761");

children.name: OrderGuide(String sys_id)
children.text: Creates an instance of the OrderGuide class with the specified sys_id.

children.name: String
children.text: sys_id of the order guide.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cart=new sn_sc.OrderGuide("6690750f4f7b4200086eeed18110c761"); console.log(cart.getID());

children.name: getID()
children.text: Returns the sys_id of the order guide.

children.name: request
children.text: Map
children.text2: A JSON object with the Catalog item and variable details.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var guide = new sn_sc.OrderGuide('6690750f4f7b4200086eeed18110c761'); var map = {}; map.variables = {}; //map.sysparm_id = '6690750f4f7b4200086eeed18110c761'; map.variables['IOce433d0f4f7b4200086eeed18110c74d'] = '221f3db5c6112284009f4becd3039cc9'; //Here ce433d0f4f7b4200086eeed18110c74d is the sys_id of the variable and 221f3db5c6112284009f4becd3039cc9 is its value var includedItems = guide.init(map)

children.name: Map
children.text: A JSON object with the initialised order guide details.

children.name: init(Map request)
children.text:
Initialises the order guide with the specified catalog items and the variables, and
    returns the order guide.

children.name: Output
children.text: true

children.name: Example
children.text: var orderGuide=new sn_sc.OrderGuide("6690750f4f7b4200086eeed18110c761"); console.log(orderGuide.isIncludeItems());

children.name: Boolean
children.text: Returns true if the Show Include Toggle check box is selected for the specified order guide. Else, returns false.

children.name: isIncludeItems()
children.text: Specifies if the Show Include Toggle (include_items) check box is selected for the specified order guide.
children.text2: Note: The Show Include Toggle field does not appear on the Order guide form by default.

children.name: Output
children.text: false

children.name: Example
children.text: var orderGuide=new sn_sc.OrderGuide("6690750f4f7b4200086eeed18110c761"); console.log(orderGuide.isTwoStep());

children.name: Boolean
children.text: Returns true if the two-step checkout is enabled. Else returns false.

children.name: isTwoStep()
children.text: Specifies if the two-step checkout is enabled.

children.name: Output
children.text: false

children.name: Example
children.text: var orderGuide=new sn_sc.OrderGuide("6690750f4f7b4200086eeed18110c761"); console.log (orderGuide.isUseCustomCart());

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Returns true if a separate cart usage is enabled for a two-step order guide.
                Else, returns false.

children.name: isUseCustomCart()
children.text:
Specifies if a separate cart (different from that for catalog items) usage is enabled
    for a two-step order guide.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: Example
children.text: var orderGuide=new sn_sc.OrderGuide.navigateFromMap(itemdetails);

children.name: itemDetails
children.text: Map
children.text2: A JSON object with details of catalog items in the order guide.

children.name: navigateFromMap(Map itemDetails)
children.text: Navigates to the catalog items of an order guide.

name: OrderGuide
text: The OrderGuide API enables you to initialize and view order guide details.
text2: To use this class in a scoped application, use the sn_sc namespace identifier. The Service Catalog Scoped API plugin (com.glideapp.servicecatalog.scoped.api) that is enabled by default is required to access the OrderGuide API.
